sentence.Network_en: The terrain's high points provide a panoramic view of Los Angeles.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这个地区的制高点能够看到洛杉矶的全景。

sentence.Network_en: Frank Mariano negotiates the desert terrain in his battered pickup.
sentence.Network_cn: 弗兰克·马里亚诺驾驶他那辆破烂不堪的皮卡车成功穿越了沙漠地带。

sentence.Network_en: It took us the whole day to trek across the rocky terrain.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们花了一整天的时间艰难地穿过那片遍布岩石的地带.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (denoting part of the training ground in a riding school): from French, from a popular Latin variant of Latin terrenum, neuter of terrenus (see terrene)

entry.def: Terrain is used to refer to an area of land or a type of land when you are considering its physical features.

example.ex: The terrain changed quickly from arable land to desert.
example.tran: 那个地带很快就从耕地变成了沙漠。

example.ex: ...a tortuous eight-hour coach ride around 1,200 bends of rough terrain.
example.tran: 在崎岖不平的地势上拐了 1,200 个弯、长达 8 小时的冗长的长途汽车旅行

means.word_mean: 1. a piece of ground having specific characteristics or military potential;

sentences.sentence: "they decided to attack across the rocky terrain"

auth_sentence.content: It only finds out about terrain after the fact.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It only finds out about terrain after the fact.

auth_sentence.content: Ideology is mere summer clouds above an unchanging terrain.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ideology is mere summer clouds above an unchanging terrain.

auth_sentence.content: It also includes areas with extreme climate or terrain.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =earth,表示"土地"; 2. =frighten,可怕,恐惧; 3. =frighten,表示"恐,怕"

stems_affixes.value_cn: [comeing from]地球外的, 宇宙的[outside the earth]
stems_affixes.word_buile: extra外+terrestrial[adj.地球的，地球上的]→adj.[comeing from]地球外的, 宇宙的[outside the earth]
mediterranean而来→n.地中海 adj.地中海的
subterrane[n.下层; 洞穴, 地下室]+ean→adj.地下的
terr土地+estrial→adj.地球的，地球上的
territory[n.领土;版图;领域,范围]+ial……的→territorial领土的
deter[v.威慑,吓住]+ent……的→deterrent威慑的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 很糟的;可怕的,骇人的;极度的,厉害的
stems_affixes.word_buile: terr恐,怕+ible可..的→可怕的
terr恐,怕+ific产生……的→带来可怕→好到让人可怕的地步→极好的
extra外+territorial[adj.领土的,土地的,地方的]+ity表名词→n.治外法权
mediterranean而来→n.地中海 adj.地中海的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 下层; 洞穴, 地下室
stems_affixes.word_buile: sub下面+terr土地+ane→n.下层; 洞穴, 地下室
terr土地+ace→n.平台,阳台,露台
terr土地+ain表名词→n.地势,地形
terr土地+it+ory场所,范围→地的范围,领土
deter[v.威慑,吓住]+ment表名词→n.制止

stems_affixes.value_cn: 恐怖, 可怕的人, 恐怖时期, 恐怖行动
stems_affixes.word_buile: terr恐,怕+or表名词→n.恐怖, 可怕的人, 恐怖时期, 恐怖行动
terror恐怖+ist人→n.恐怖分子
dis离,出+inter埋→v.挖出,掘土
in进+ter=terr土地→v.埋葬
de去+ter=terr恐,怕→吓跑了,吓得不动了
terr恐,怕+ify使……→v.使害怕,使惊恐

means.word_mean: 地形, 地面, 地域, 地带

sentences.en: He had made a detailed study of the terrain.
sentences.cn: 他对地形作了缜密的研究。

jushi.english: The city spread out on a level terrain.
jushi.chinese: 城市向平坦的地带扩展。

jushi.english: The car handles particularly well on rough terrain.
jushi.chinese: 这种汽车特别能应付崎岖的地形。
